meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get this LEGO party started!

I'm here to shake things up (or at least add some humor) while reviewing The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame. Now, I know what you're thinking: "Ugh, a movie tie-in game? That sounds like a snooze-fest." But fear not, young players and old alike! I've got the inside scoop on whether this game is as awesome as a certain Minion's antics or more like, well... let's just say it's not so much.

First off, let me give a shout-out to my fellow critics. You know, those folks who make us laugh with their witty one-liners (ahem, COGconnected). Sorry, COGconnected, but even the most dedicated LEGO fans might find themselves feeling like they're stuck in an endless loop of frustration (COGconnected's review). And don't even get me started on Eurogamer Italy - that broken co-op had them singing the blues.

Now, about this game... I mean, it's not all bad. 3DJuegos thinks it has some fresh ideas, and those sandbox gameplay mechanics are pretty neat-o. But, as Cubed3 so eloquently put it: "Everything is just meh." Ouch!

I won't lie; this game had me feeling like President Business himself - bored out of my mind! (TheSixthAxis, you're not alone in your disappointment). And don't even get me started on the graphics issues mentioned by Meristation. Yikes!

All joking aside, if you're a young LEGO enthusiast looking for some fun and creative gameplay, this game might be worth checking out - especially since it's designed for kids! But let's just say it won't be winning any awards anytime soon.

In conclusion, I'll leave you with my own review: "The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is a bit of an acquired taste. It's like that one weird cousin at the family reunion - you're not sure if they're going to be fun or a total downer. But hey, it's worth playing if only for those sweet, sweet LEGO visuals!"
